p: The most common symptoms at the onset of illness were fever (79.1%), dry cough (79.1%), expectoration (39.6%), fatigue (38.5%), and shortness of breath (29.7%), while diarrhea (14.3%) and nausea and vomiting (7.7%) were not rare. In total, 87 (95.6%) patients had more than one sign or symptom, and 23 patients had combined fever, cough, and shortness of breath. Only four (4.4%) cases had no symptoms. The median highest temperature was 38.0 °C, and the median duration of fever was eight days. Nine (9.9%) patients were admitted and transferred to the ICU because of the ARDS and organ dysfunction. The median durations from the first symptoms to hospital admission and ARDS were five days (IQR: 3–9) and 8 days (IQR: 6–10), respectively.
